posts.title: Celebrating National Day â€” Together for Our Motherland
posts.text: The Splendor of the Land and the Joy of Celebration â€” Written on the Eve of National Day ğŸ‰ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³As autumn breezes sweep across the vast land of China and the morning glow paints the mountains in red, we once again welcome a meaningful moment â€” October 1st, National Day, the birthday of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China. On this day, no special ceremony is needed â€” the feeling of patriotism quietly rises in every heart. Look around: on the bustling city streets, the Five-Star Red Flags wave proudly under the golden sun; in peaceful villages, crimson flags flutter above smoke curling from chimneys â€” humble but heartfelt signs of joy. Shop windows glow with â€œChina Redâ€ decorations, children wave little flags, and social media overflows with â€œI love you, China.â€ These small yet heartwarming moments come together to form the ritual beauty of this festival, turning â€œNational Dayâ€ from a date on the calendar into a shared emotional memory for every Chinese person. We often say that National Day is more than a holiday â€” it is a mirror that lets us look back at history. It reminds us of the solemn declaration over 70 years ago: â€œThe Central Peopleâ€™s Government of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China is established!â€ It recalls generations of hard work and perseverance that carried the nation from poverty to prosperity. At the same time, it is also a beacon of the future, reminding us that todayâ€™s peace and comfort are built upon the sweat and dedication of countless people â€” and that the journey toward a better tomorrow continues with our shared efforts. On this glorious and hopeful day, there is so much to say from the heart: Gratitude to our Motherland, whose strength provides us a safe and stable home. From border defense to daily life, from technological breakthroughs to social progress â€” it is the steady rise of our nation that gives us the confidence to stand tall in the world and pursue happiness fearlessly. Gratitude for everyday life, where beauty hides in simplicity â€” a warm breakfast at dawn, a cozy dinner with family, the convenience of travel, a peaceful walk in the park. These small joys are threads in the fabric of happiness, reminding us that â€œwhen the country prospers, the people thrive.â€ Hope for growing with our nation â€” though we may be ordinary individuals in our roles, every bit of hard work, every act of kindness, every moment of diligence contributes to the nationâ€™s progress. May we all paint our own stories on the canvas of our era, walking alongside our country toward a brighter future. Finally, let us offer our sincerest blessings â€” to our beloved country, and to everyone striving for a better life: ğŸ† May our Motherland remain splendid and prosperous for generations to come. May you have a joyful and peaceful National Day filled with happiness and strength! ğŸ†

posts.title: The Origin and Blessings of the Mid-Autumn Festival
posts.text: ğŸŒ• The Origin and Blessings of the Mid-Autumn FestivalThe Mid-Autumn Festival, also known as the Moon Festival or Mooncake Festival, is one of Chinaâ€™s four major traditional holidays. It originated from ancient moon worship and autumn harvest celebrations. According to historical records, it became an official festival during the Tang Dynasty and was widely celebrated among the people by the Song Dynasty. On this day, families gather to admire the moon, eat mooncakes, and celebrate reunion. The famous legend of Changâ€™e flying to the moon adds a touch of romance to this festival. Over time, the moon came to symbolize homesickness, longing, and family reunion â€” making the Mid-Autumn Festival a celebration of togetherness and affection. ğŸ¥® Traditional Customs Moon Gazing: Admiring the bright full moon and expressing love and longing for distant family members. Eating Mooncakes: Representing unity, happiness, and completeness. Riddle Guessing: A fun and meaningful activity that brings joy and wisdom to the festival. ğŸ‰ Festival WishesOn this beautiful night of the full moon, may you have: âœ¨ Success in your career and sweetness in life;ğŸŒ¸ Happiness in your family and good health always;ğŸŒ• Wishes fulfilled and hearts united! posts.title: Deploying a Hexo Blog on GitHub Pages â€” A Complete Guide
posts.text: When it comes to building a personal blog, Hexo + GitHub Pages is one of the most popular solutions.This guide walks you through every step, from setup to deployment, helping you create your own online blog quickly and easily. 1. Connect Git to GitHub (SSH Recommended)During deployment, we need to enable communication between your local environment and GitHub. Itâ€™s recommended to use SSH to avoid typing your credentials every time. Open your terminal (Git Bash on Windows, Terminal on macOS/Linux) and generate an SSH key: 1ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@example.com" Replace your_email@example.com with your GitHub account email. Press Enter three times to accept defaults â€” your key will be saved in: Windows: C:\Users\YourName\.ssh macOS/Linux: ~/.ssh Locate the id_rsa.pub file (the public key), open it with a text editor, and copy the contents. Go to GitHub â†’ Settings â†’ SSH and GPG keys â†’ New SSH key Title: something like â€œMy PCâ€ Key: paste your public key Click Add SSH key Test your connection: 1ssh -T git@github.com Type yes if prompted. If you see: Hi username! You've successfully authenticated... Then the SSH setup is complete. 2. Configure Hexo Deployment to GitHubAfter connecting GitHub, edit your Hexo configuration file to enable automatic deployment. 1. Edit _config.ymlAt the end of the file, locate the deploy section and modify it like this: 1234deploy: type: git repo: https://github.com/username/username.github.io.git # Or SSH: git@github.com:username/username.github.io.git branch: main 2. Install Deployment PluginRun the following command in your Hexo project directory: 1npm install hexo-deployer-git --save 3. Configure Git User InfoSet your global Git username and email (first-time setup only): 12git config --global user.name "yourname"git config --global user.email "youremail@example.com" Verify your configuration: 12git config user.namegit config user.email 3. Publish Blog to GitHub PagesOnce everything is configured, you can push your blog to GitHub Pages. Create a Test Post (optional): 1hexo new "My First Hexo Blog" Generate Static Files: 12hexo cleanhexo g Deploy to GitHub: 1hexo d Visit Your Blog: Wait 1â€“5 minutes, then open: https://username.github.io 4. Common Issues & Fixes Canâ€™t Find GitHub Username?Your username is the part after / in your GitHub profile URL. Example:https://github.com/octocat â†’ username is octocat. Git Configuration ProblemsBe sure thereâ€™s a space between user.name and "yourname" when setting values: 12git config --global user.name "yourname"git config --global user.email "youremail@example.com" Upload Failed or TimeoutYou may need to set up a proxy or use SSH for better stability. SummaryNow youâ€™ve learned how to: Connect to GitHub using SSH Configure Hexo for automatic deployment Use hexo g and hexo d to publish your blog online Congratulations â€” your personal Hexo blog is live! ğŸš€

posts.title: Recommended Python Programming Tools (Including Pricing and Download Links)
posts.text: Recommended Python Programming Tools (Including Pricing and Download Links)When learning Python, having the right programming tool can greatly improve efficiency and experience. Whether youâ€™re a beginner writing your first line of code or a developer working on complex projects, choosing the right tool is very important. Below, Iâ€™ll introduce several common Python programming tools with pricing information and official download addresses for quick access. 1. Python Official IDE (IDLE)IDLE is the official development tool that comes with Python. You can use it directly after installing Python without additional configuration. Advantages: Zero configuration, simple and easy to use, built-in interactive window. Disadvantages: Limited functionality, lacks intelligent suggestions and plugins. Pricing: Completely free. Official Download: https://www.python.org/downloads/ Target Users: Python beginners. 2. VS CodeVisual Studio Code (VS Code) is currently one of the most popular code editors with excellent Python support. Advantages: Lightweight, rich plugins, cross-platform. Disadvantages: Powerful features but requires manual plugin installation and configuration. Pricing: Completely free. Official Download: https://code.visualstudio.com/ Target Users: Most Python learners and developers. 3. PyCharmPyCharm is a professional Python IDE from JetBrains with very powerful features. Advantages: Complete code completion, debugging, testing, virtual environment management, suitable for large projects. Disadvantages: Resource-heavy, high resource consumption. Pricing: Community Edition: Free Professional Edition: Paid, personal subscription about $89/year Official Download: https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/download/ Target Users: Intermediate to advanced developers who need a complete development environment. 4. Jupyter NotebookJupyter Notebook is a commonly used tool in data science and machine learning fields. Advantages: Interactive programming, supports mixed display of code, text, and charts, perfect for experiments and process documentation. Disadvantages: Not suitable for large project development. Pricing: Completely free (open source), cloud-based advanced GPU/TPU resources may be paid. Official Download: https://jupyter.org/install Target Users: Data scientists, researchers, students. 5. ThonnyThonny is a Python IDE designed for beginners with a clean interface and simple functionality. Advantages: User-friendly interface, built-in debugger, lightweight, easy installation. Disadvantages: Limited functionality, not suitable for large project development. Pricing: Completely free. Official Download: https://thonny.org/ Target Users: Programming beginners, educational scenarios. 6. Turtle EditorTurtle Editor is a fun tool for Python beginners, commonly used for teaching and graphics. Advantages: Visually demonstrates code effects through turtle graphics, highly engaging. Disadvantages: Limited functionality, not suitable for complex development. Pricing: Free. Official Download: https://python-course.eu/python-turtle.php Target Users: Children, programming beginners. 7. Sublime TextSublime Text is a lightweight, fast editor that supports Python. Advantages: Fast speed, supports multiple languages, clean interface. Disadvantages: Features require plugin supplementation, Python experience not as good as VS Code. Pricing: Unlimited free trial, official license about $99. Official Download: https://www.sublimetext.com/ Target Users: Users who prefer clean editors. Tool Comparison Table Tool Pricing Difficulty Feature Range Target Users Official Download IDLE Free â˜… Basic programming Beginners Python Official VS Code Free â˜…â˜… Plugin extensions, suitable for various development Most learners and developers VS Code Official PyCharm Free (Community)/Paid (Professional) â˜…â˜…â˜… Complete IDE, enterprise development Intermediate to advanced developers PyCharm Official Jupyter Notebook Free (local/basic cloud)/Partially paid â˜…â˜… Data science, machine learning Data science, researchers Jupyter Official Thonny Free â˜… Simple teaching IDE Beginners Thonny Official Turtle Editor Free â˜… Visual graphics Beginners Turtle Official Sublime Text Trial/Paid â˜…â˜… Lightweight editor Users seeking simplicity Sublime Official Summary Want simple quick start: Use IDLE or Thonny directly. Want powerful free tools: Recommend VS Code. Want professional IDE: Choose PyCharm (Professional paid, Community free). Want data science/machine learning: Use Jupyter Notebook. Want fun learning: Try Turtle Editor. Want lightweight coding: Try Sublime Text. Choosing the right tool not only improves programming efficiency but also makes learning more enjoyable. Hope this article helps you find the most suitable Python programming companion! âœï¸ Which Python tool do you use most often? Welcome to share your experience in the comments!

posts.title: Writing and Publishing Your First Blog with Hexo on GitHub Pages
posts.text: In the previous article, we completed the basic setup of Hexo and successfully deployed the site to GitHub Pages. Today, letâ€™s write your first blog post and publish it online. 1. Create a New PostRun the following command in your Hexo project root directory: 1hexo new post "My First Blog" This will generate a Markdown file under source/_posts/ named My First Blog.md. You can open it with your favorite editor (such as VS Code) and start writing: 123456789---title: My First Blogdate: 2025-09-21 12:00:00tags: [Essay, Hexo]---This is my first blog post written with Hexo!Iâ€™ll be sharing more technical tutorials here in the future. 2. Preview LocallyOnce finished, start the local Hexo server to preview the result: 1hexo s Visit http://localhost:4000 in your browser â€” you should see your new post on the homepage. 3. Generate Static FilesIf everything looks fine, generate the static files: 1hexo generate (Shortcut: hexo g) The generated files will be stored in the public/ folder. 4. Deploy to GitHub PagesFinally, deploy your blog online by running: 1hexo deploy (Shortcut: hexo d) After a few seconds, youâ€™ll be able to access your post at your GitHub Pages address, e.g.:https://yourusername.github.io/ 5. SummaryHereâ€™s the full workflow of writing and publishing a Hexo post on GitHub Pages: hexo new post "Post Title" â†’ Create a new post Edit the post content hexo s â†’ Preview locally hexo g â†’ Generate static files hexo d â†’ Deploy to GitHub Pages Always run hexo clean before deploying to clear old cache! Simple, right? ğŸ‰Now you can continue writing more posts or start customizing your theme!

posts.title: Remembering History, Cherishing Peace â€” 80th Anniversary of the Victory of Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and World Anti-Fascist War
posts.text: Remembering History to Safeguard Peace, Passing the Torch to the Future â€” Written on September 3rd, the 80th Anniversary of the Victory of Chinese Peopleâ€™s War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and World Anti-Fascist War âœŠğŸ•Šï¸Today is September 3rd â€” a special day engraved deep in the memory of the Chinese nation and forever recorded in the annals of world peace. Eighty years ago at this moment, after 14 years of bloody struggle, the Chinese people finally welcomed the great victory of the Chinese Peopleâ€™s War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression. Meanwhile, the world anti-fascist alliance fought side by side, completely crushing the aggressive ambitions of fascism and letting the dawn of peace shine again on the land devastated by war. Looking back at those years of broken mountains and rivers, stormy times, the Chinese people, under extremely harsh conditions, with the national integrity of â€œbetter to be broken jade than intact tile,â€ used their flesh and blood to build the Great Wall against foreign invasion. From the great victory at Pingxingguan that broke the myth of â€œJapanese invincibility,â€ to the Hundred Regiments Offensive that boosted national morale; from countless martyrsâ€™ heroic â€œsacrificing lives for the country, viewing death as homecoming,â€ to hundreds of millions of peopleâ€™s perseverance of â€œone inch of mountains and rivers, one inch of blood; one hundred thousand youths, one hundred thousand soldiersâ€ â€” we exchanged the dignity of national independence with the tremendous sacrifice of 35 million compatriots, and made indelible contributions to the victory of the world anti-fascist war. Remembering this history has never been about perpetuating hatred, but about drawing strength from suffering and safeguarding peace through commemoration. Todayâ€™s national peace and tranquil years are the â€œhard-wonâ€ gift exchanged by countless martyrs with their lives. In this happiness lies the belief we must uphold: Peace is the most precious gift. Having experienced the ravages of war, we better understand the value of tranquility. Every ordinary day of stable life is a treasure that we need to cherish and defend with action, tolerating no slack or carelessness. History is the spiritual backbone of the nation. Those heroic stories engraved in mountains and rivers, the spirit of resistance flowing in our bloodline, are the confidence for the Chinese nation to weather storms and forge ahead. Forgetting history equals severing the spiritual genes of the nation; remembering history keeps the nationâ€™s backbone forever upright. Self-strengthening is the foundation for safeguarding the future. The victory 80 years ago tells us that only through unity and self-improvement can we resist risks and control our destiny. Today, we need to learn from history, strive in our respective positions, and use national prosperity and national rejuvenation to build a solid foundation for peace, making the bright future increasingly stable through generations. Eighty years have passed, mountains and rivers have taken on a new appearance, but the echoes of that history have never faded. Let us move forward with commemoration for martyrs, cherishing peace, and expectations for the future â€” with the youth of our generation, protecting prosperous China, letting the torch of peace pass on forever, and the spirit of the nation continue through generations. ğŸ•¯ï¸ Let us jointly remember history, pay tribute to heroes, cherish peace, and create a better future! ğŸ•Šï¸
